instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00138: What is 820-00138? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image to display. Works fine on External
threads.message:
Hello all. First post here. so bare with me. 

Symtoms: No image to internal Display. Works fine on external. 

Still trying to understand the Retina eDP Display Circuit. I can't find a BRD file for this Model so I'm a little confused as the <SIGNAL>PP5VR3V3_SW</SIGNAL> LCD line differs to other models. 

Tested with KG Display - No Change

No Signs of Liquid Damage.

L3800 has a spike of 5V then goes to 0V. I'm guessing thats normal and is meant to power the display so it can talk over DDC?

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> - 5V

I can not find <CHIP>U8300</CHIP> on the board so i am unsure if i have <SIGNAL>LCD_PWR_5V_RC</SIGNAL>. 

Seeing as i have no image and no backlight I'm guessing its a DDC issue. What line handles that on the Retina models? <SIGNAL>LCD_HPD</SIGNAL>?

Any help is much appreciated.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image to display. Works fine on External
threads.message: EDID information is read through the AUX DP lines. In this case the first suspects would be the LCD cable or the LCD itself, try a known good assembly. Must be 2015 model, older LCDs don't work.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image to display. Works fine on External
threads.message: Just double checked with the Tech that sent this to me. He was using a mid 2014 display... ? now that ain’t gonna work is it? Thanks for making me double check that. Will test with a mid 2015 when I’m in.
